If P(A) = 0.3 and P(B) = 0.4, and A, B are mutually exclusive, find P(A ∪ B).
For mutually exclusive events, P(A ∪ B) = P(A) + P(B) = 0.3 + 0.4 = 0.7.
If P(A) = 0.5 and P(B) = 0.6, and A, B are independent, find P(A ∩ B).
For independent events, P(A ∩ B) = P(A) × P(B) = 0.5 × 0.6 = 0.3.

If two events A and B are independent, which is true?
For independent events, P(A ∩ B) = P(A) × P(B).
